dashboard.title: Anchorr Configuration
dashboard.subtitle: Anchorr needs to be connected with your Discord bot and with your Jellyfin and Jellyseerr instances.
dashboard.subtitle_detail: Below is a step-by-step walkthrough to help you set up everything you need to get started!

config.title: Configuration
config.language_help: Select your preferred language for the interface.
config.discord_instructions_intro: First, you need to create a Discord application for the bot. Access Discord Developer Portal and log in. Create a new application, then:
config.discord_instructions_1: Go to "Bot" in the sidebar and click "Add Bot"
config.discord_instructions_2: In the "Bot" section, scroll down to "Privileged Gateway Intents" and enable SERVER MEMBERS INTENT (required for user mappings feature)
config.discord_instructions_6: Copy the generated URL, open it in your browser, and authorize the bot on your Discord server
config.discord_instructions_7: Come back here and fill in the Discord Bot Token and Bot Client ID below, then select your server and notification channel from the dropdowns
config.discord_token_help: The secret token of your bot from the Discord Developer Portal ‚Üí Bot ‚Üí Reset Token
config.bot_id_help: The application's client ID from the Discord Developer Portal ‚Üí OAuth2 ‚Üí Client ID
config.auto_start_info: Auto-Start: The bot will automatically start when you enter and save Discord credentials for the first time.
config.discord_server_help: Select the Discord server where the bot will operate. Make sure you've added the bot to your server first.
config.episode_channel_help: Optional: Choose a different channel specifically for episode notifications. Leave empty to use the default channel.
config.season_channel_help: Optional: Choose a different channel specifically for season notifications. Leave empty to use the default channel.
config.default_channel_help: Select the default Discord channel for Jellyfin notifications. You can override this per-library in Step 4. Choose a server above first.
config.jellyseerr_url_help: The full URL of your Jellyseerr instance.
config.jellyseerr_api_key_help: Your API key from Jellyseerr settings
config.tmdb_api_key_help: A TMDB API Key is required for searching and fetching movie/show details. You can find it in the API settings page of your TMDB account after you log in.
config.omdb_api_key_help: Optional, but recommended for richer data like ratings and directors. Create one on the API Key page of OMDb.
config.jellyfin_url_help: The public URL of your Jellyfin server. Used for the "Watch Now" button.
config.jellyfin_api_key_help: API key for your Jellyfin server. You can generate one in Jellyfin Dashboard ‚Üí Administration ‚Üí API Keys. This is required for loading libraries and enhanced features.
config.test_endpoint_help: Testing the endpoint successfully will automatically populate the Jellyfin Server ID field.
config.jellyfin_server_id_help: Used for redirecting to the correct path of your Jellyfin server media page when using the "Watch Now" button. You can find this in your Jellyfin URL when viewing the page of any movie or show from your library.

about.title: About Anchorr
about.description: Anchorr is a self-hosted, lightweight bridge that connects your Jellyfin media server with Discord. It notifies you on a dedicated channel when new media is added to your library, and with Jellyseerr integration, you can search and request movies and shows directly from Discord.
about.feature_search: /search <title> Search for a movie or show with auto-suggestions. An embed with detailed information is shown, from which you can request the media. For TV shows, you have the option to select the desired seasons for the request.
about.feature_request: /request <title> Instantly send a request for your chosen movie or show directly to Jellyseerr. For TV shows, this automatically requests all seasons.
about.feature_notifications: Receive beautifully formatted notifications on your selected Discord channel whenever new media is added to your Jellyfin library.
about.feature_databases: Using the TMDB and OMDb databases, Discord messages get a beautiful and well-structured look, with essential information about the requested or added media content.
about.feature_permissions: Control permissions with role-based access (allowlist/blocklist), route notifications to different channels by Jellyfin library, and link users to Jellyseerr accounts for accurate request tracking.
about.feature_direct_messages: Get direct messages on Discord when requested content becomes available in your library. Never miss when your requests are ready!
about.support_description: If you find Anchorr useful, consider supporting its development. Every coffee helps fuel late-night coding sessions!
about.contribute_description: Anchorr is open-source! If you're a developer, your contributions are welcome. Check out the project on GitHub to get started.

jellyfin_webhook.note: If you're running Anchorr in Docker, you may need to replace localhost with your server's IP address.
jellyfin_webhook.plugin_install: If you don't have the plugin installed, access the Plugins page in your Jellyfin Dashboard, search for Webhook, install it and restart the server.
jellyfin_webhook.plugin_setup: After the restart, access your Webhook plugin settings and Add Discord Destination.
jellyfin_webhook.step_server_url: Complete the Server Url with your Jellyfin server's base URL.
jellyfin_webhook.step_webhook_url: Insert the previously specified URL in the Webhook Url field.
jellyfin_webhook.step_notification_type: For Notification Type enable Item Added.
jellyfin_webhook.step_item_type: For Item Type select your desired content you want to receive notifications for.
